<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/25/best-buy-online-sales-surge-242-q2?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Got iPads?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Best Buy tablet" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjExL2Jlc3RfYnV5X3RhYmxldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Best Buy jumped from “I forgot about you” to “pesky mosquito” on Jeff Bezos’s hit list. The electronics retailer <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/25/best-buy-bby-q2-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flexed</a> some impressive Q2 earnings, including $9.9 billion in revenue, sales increases in nearly every category, and same-store sales growth at a two-year high. Despite a slight dip yesterday, its stock remains near a record. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These earnings are worth a closer look, because Best Buy sits smack dab in the middle of some of the biggest economic trends.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. An ecommerce boom </strong>lifted online sales 242% yearly in the U.S. Best Buy is expecting this shift to last beyond the pandemic, which means some changes ahead.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Next month, Best Buy’s </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/25/best-buy-experiments-with-stores-as-it-bets-on-online-shopping-shift.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">converting</a></span><span> about a quarter of its stores into shipping hubs to boost delivery speeds. It’ll also add more third-party locations for customer pickups, on top of the 16,000 it currently has.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. People are working from home, </strong>which means sprucing up the home office, upgrading the laptop/tablet, and splurging on an air fryer. Best Buy customers are also shelling out for wellness products like home fitness gear, outdoor and camping equipment, and digital health.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. Back to school season looks different. </strong>With many schools pivoting to hybrid or remote learning, parents turned to Best Buy to get their kids the necessary gadgets. But all that demand has led to an inventory crunch. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Bulk orders from school systems and sanctions on Chinese suppliers have left laptops and tablets </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/01e9302796d749b6aadc35ddc8f4c946?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in short supply</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Last week, Best Buy had 36 Chromebook models costing under $500 listed on its website. 33 were sold out, the AP reports.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">4. Consumer spending </strong>was propped up in July by stimulus checks and extra unemployment benefits. But after benefits expired, shoppers tightened purse strings, Best Buy said. And consumer confidence just hit its <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-25/u-s-consumer-confidence-falls-to-lowest-level-in-six-years?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lowest level</a> in six years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Best Buy is holding off making predictions for the rest of the year and carefully watching negotiations on the Hill for new COVID-19 stimulus measures. It could get some fuel from the upcoming holiday season and fall product launches, including the new iPhone.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/25/american-airlines-will-shrink-workforce-30?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
AA Major Round of Layoffs Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="American Airlines plane" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjEwL2FtZXJpY2FuX2FpcmxpbmVzX3BsYW5lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sergey Kustov, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:American_Airlines_Boeing_777-200ER_Kustov.jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">American Airlines Boeing 777-200ER Kustov</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 3.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, American Airlines said its headcount will <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/25/business/american-airlines-job-cuts/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shrink</a> by 30% below March levels by Oct. 1. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That’s 19,000 involuntary cuts and furloughs, including pilots, flight attendants, management staff, mechanics, and others. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The pandemic has devastated air travel. So as part of the CARES Act Congress passed in March, U.S. airlines nabbed $25 billion to keep workers on the payroll. But that bailout money is running out, and the summer travel bump (as small as it was) is almost over. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The industry hoped for a fresh infusion, but talks for another aid package in Congress have stalled. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And like a “minor delay” on the tarmac, there’s no end in sight for the air travel slowdown. Demand is around 30% of last year, and execs say a full rebound will take years. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">American’s woes are just one example of the industry's deep rut. Last month, United sent notices to 36,000 employees saying they could be furloughed. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> This is “the clearest sign yet of the devastation coming for the airline industry," <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/american-airlines-to-cut-19-000-jobs-11598367869?mod=djemalertNEWS&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> the WSJ.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORKPLACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/25/report-shows-spike-us-workers-testing-positive-drug-use?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Workplace Drug Use Hits a...We’re Not Gonna Say It
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A new report from Quest Diagnostics <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/american-workers-testing-positive-for-drugs-reach-highest-level-in-16-years-11598347802?mod=hp_lista_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">showed that</a> 4.5% of U.S. workers tested positive for drugs last year. That’s the highest percentage in 16 years, and it represents a 29% increase from 10 years ago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One driver? </strong>More marijuana use—the number of workers testing positive for marijuana was up 11% over 2018. That number increased 29% over 2015, the time frame when about a half a dozen additional states legalized marijuana for recreational use. Some employers in those states are slowing their roll on marijuana testing, but not for jobs that involve serious safety hazards. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As for 2020</strong>...we don’t know just yet, but initial data indicates substance abuse and drug-related deaths are trending up as the pandemic disrupted everyone’s social and professional lives. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A NYT analysis </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/07/15/upshot/drug-overdose-deaths.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">showed that</a></span><span> as of July, drug deaths had risen an average of 13% yearly. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some Good News to read to yourself in John Krasinski voice: Positive tests for opiates continued their decline in 2019. </p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TBH, crypto hasn’t done itself a favor by having a name like crypto. It sounds like something only people in leather pants and dark sunglasses talk about at bars called JUIC3 or Spider’s Web.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But it’s more sci-fi than non-fiction. Especially since <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/474497555;279358904;g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">eToro</a> has created a crypto trading platform that welcomes any and all—no Morpheus shades necessary. </p>

You can even <strong style="color:#000">copy the moves of successful crypto traders</strong>—i.e. you can trade like the best, right from the start.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And now when you <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/474497555;279358904;g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sign up for an eToro account</a> and purchase $500 worth of crypto, <strong style="color:#000">they’ll give you a $50 bonus</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’d like to see the bouncer at Spider’s Web match that.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/25/herd-immunity-potentially-achieved-certain-locations-around-globe-say-experts?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Follow the Herd
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NYPL lion wearing a mask" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTU3L255cGxfbGlvbl93ZWFyaW5nX2FfbWFzay5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><div class="bucketwrap image large"><div class="credit-caption"><span class="credit">Jonathan Blanc/New York Public Library</span></div></div></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Herd immunity:</strong> when enough people have developed immune resistance to stop a pathogen from spreading. This can happen by vaccination or old fashioned cough-on-your-desk-buddy infection.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Researchers are trying to suss out the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/17/health/coronavirus-herd-immunity.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">threshold needed</a> to stop COVID-19’s spread. Some peg it at 50% of a population or less.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Are we close? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cities with severe outbreaks this spring may have experienced enough community transmission to develop some form of herd immunity.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>NYC hasn’t seen a major uptick in infections this summer.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In some urban areas in India, where as many as 60% of residents contracted COVID, new cases have </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2020-08-23/herd-immunity-in-india?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">begun to slow.</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The city of Manaus experienced one of Brazil’s worst outbreaks, but hospitalizations and deaths have </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/brazil-coronavirus-manaus-herd-immunity/2020/08/23/0eccda40-d80e-11ea-930e-d88518c57dcc_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fallen sharply</a></span><span> since May. And Manaus never imposed strict lockdowns.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One country took a high-profile gamble on herd immunity. Sweden kept businesses open this spring, and a handful of health experts say the country has <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/sweden-has-developed-herd-immunity-after-refusing-to-lock-down-experts-claim-its-coronavirus-infection-rate-is-falling-2020-08-24?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">developed</a> resistance. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Many medical leaders are wary about declaring herd immunity. Subsequent outbreaks could still occur, and immunologists don’t know how long an immune response lasts.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/25/napster-sells-music-vr-company-70m?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Napster Enters Its Third Life
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Get ready to feel old and young at the same time: Napster just <a href="https://www.rollingstone.com/pro/news/melodyvr-buys-napster-streaming-service-1049716/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold for $70 million</a> to a virtual reality concert company. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">MelodyVR allows users to watch concerts in VR; it’s already done events with the likes of Post Malone, John Legend, and Khalid. Now, it wants to add music streaming to its platform. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Enter Napster. </strong>The brand launched in 1999 as a music-sharing platform...which is a nice way of saying it lets listeners commit music piracy. The company went bankrupt after artists sued, then bounced around various owners until it was acquired by streaming service Rhapsody in 2011. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Five years later, Rhapsody rebranded as Napster and added B2B to its D2C mixtape.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Napster might have just 1% of Spotify's paying customer base, but it’s still one of the most recognizable names in digital music. Paying for at-home VR concerts might’ve been a tough sell for MelodyVR last year, but in this economy...</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Artificial intelligence is really complicated—there’s a reason why people who work in the field have an average of 7.5 PhDs.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But AI and related concepts like machine learning are playing an increasingly important role in our lives, shaping everything from the videos on our TikTok feed to the global stock market.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To help explain what AI is and why it matters, Emerging Tech Brew put together an <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/guides/what-is-ai?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">incredible guide</a> that’ll answer all your questions, including…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>What is an algorithm?</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Should we be worried about AI bias? </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Is AI a serious threat to human jobs? </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Why was </span><span><em>WALL·E </em></span><span>snubbed of a Best Picture nomination? </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Get smart on AI and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/guides/what-is-ai?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">read the guide</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How do you measure up?</strong> This <a href="https://www.bluebulbprojects.com/MeasureOfThings/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fun site</a> lets you input measurements to get interesting comparisons. We immediately dialed in our own heights and weights and now know we sit comfortably between a Giant Pacific Octopus and half a reindeer. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Mindless fun: </strong>Be your company's hero today by sharing this <a href="https://gamindo.com/games/morningbrewgame/V5/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">seriously addicting game</a> developed by the good folks at Italian startup <a href="https://gamindo.com/en/homepage/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Gamindo</a>. The Brew almost didn’t get written today because of the high-score chase. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For the designers...</strong>IKEA just released 70 years-worth of their catalogs in digital format. It's a <a href="https://ikeamuseum.com/sv/ikea-kataloger/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">feast for your eyes</a>.</p>

Rand Paul, and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo—who broke with State Department tradition to speak at a political convention.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHousing: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe housing sector is the Devin Booker to the broader economy’s Phoenix Suns. New home sales in July increased 13.9%, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/b70be81546e71bdd19b20021fbc47b4c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecrushing expectations\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Best Buy jumped from “I forgot about you” to “pesky mosquito” on Jeff Bezos’s hit list. The electronics retailer \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/25/best-buy-bby-q2-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eflexed\u003c/a\u003e some impressive Q2 earnings, including $9.9 billion in revenue, sales increases in nearly every category, and same-store sales growth at a two-year high. Despite a slight dip yesterday, its stock remains near a record. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese earnings are worth a closer look, because Best Buy sits smack dab in the middle of some of the biggest economic trends.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. An ecommerce boom \u003c/strong\u003elifted online sales 242% yearly in the U.S. Best Buy is expecting this shift to last beyond the pandemic, which means some changes ahead.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNext month, Best Buy’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/25/best-buy-experiments-with-stores-as-it-bets-on-online-shopping-shift.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econverting\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e about a quarter of its stores into shipping hubs to boost delivery speeds. It’ll also add more third-party locations for customer pickups, on top of the 16,000 it currently has.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. People are working from home, \u003c/strong\u003ewhich means sprucing up the home office, upgrading the laptop/tablet, and splurging on an air fryer. Best Buy customers are also shelling out for wellness products like home fitness gear, outdoor and camping equipment, and digital health.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. Back to school season looks different. \u003c/strong\u003eWith many schools pivoting to hybrid or remote learning, parents turned to Best Buy to get their kids the necessary gadgets. But all that demand has led to an inventory crunch. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBulk orders from school systems and sanctions on Chinese suppliers have left laptops and tablets \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/01e9302796d749b6aadc35ddc8f4c946?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein short supply\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast week, Best Buy had 36 Chromebook models costing under $500 listed on its website. 33 were sold out, the AP reports.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e4. Consumer spending \u003c/strong\u003ewas propped up in July by stimulus checks and extra unemployment benefits. But after benefits expired, shoppers tightened purse strings, Best Buy said. And consumer confidence just hit its \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-25/u-s-consumer-confidence-falls-to-lowest-level-in-six-years?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elowest level\u003c/a\u003e in six years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBest Buy is holding off making predictions for the rest of the year and carefully watching negotiations on the Hill for new COVID-19 stimulus measures. It could get some fuel from the upcoming holiday season and fall product launches, including the new iPhone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCC BY-SA 3.0\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, American Airlines said its headcount will \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/25/business/american-airlines-job-cuts/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshrink\u003c/a\u003e by 30% below March levels by Oct. 1. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat’s 19,000 involuntary cuts and furloughs, including pilots, flight attendants, management staff, mechanics, and others. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe pandemic has devastated air travel. So as part of the CARES Act Congress passed in March, U.S. airlines nabbed $25 billion to keep workers on the payroll. But that bailout money is running out, and the summer travel bump (as small as it was) is almost over. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe industry hoped for a fresh infusion, but talks for another aid package in Congress have stalled. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd like a “minor delay” on the tarmac, there’s no end in sight for the air travel slowdown. Demand is around 30% of last year, and execs say a full rebound will take years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmerican’s woes are just one example of the industry's deep rut. Last month, United sent notices to 36,000 employees saying they could be furloughed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e This is “the clearest sign yet of the devastation coming for the airline industry,\" \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/american-airlines-to-cut-19-000-jobs-11598367869?mod=djemalertNEWS\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e the WSJ.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA new report from Quest Diagnostics \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/american-workers-testing-positive-for-drugs-reach-highest-level-in-16-years-11598347802?mod=hp_lista_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshowed that\u003c/a\u003e 4.5% of U.S. workers tested positive for drugs last year. That’s the highest percentage in 16 years, and it represents a 29% increase from 10 years ago. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne driver? \u003c/strong\u003eMore marijuana use—the number of workers testing positive for marijuana was up 11% over 2018. That number increased 29% over 2015, the time frame when about a half a dozen additional states legalized marijuana for recreational use. Some employers in those states are slowing their roll on marijuana testing, but not for jobs that involve serious safety hazards. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAs for 2020\u003c/strong\u003e...we don’t know just yet, but initial data indicates substance abuse and drug-related deaths are trending up as the pandemic disrupted everyone’s social and professional lives. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA NYT analysis \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/07/15/upshot/drug-overdose-deaths.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshowed that\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e as of July, drug deaths had risen an average of 13% yearly. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome Good News to read to yourself in John Krasinski voice: style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nPUBLIC HEALTH \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/25/herd-immunity-potentially-achieved-certain-locations-around-globe-say-experts?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nFollow the Herd\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"NYPL lion wearing a mask\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"bucketwrap image large\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"credit-caption\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"credit\"\u003eJonathan Blanc/New York Public Library\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHerd immunity:\u003c/strong\u003e when enough people have developed immune resistance to stop a pathogen from spreading. This can happen by vaccination or old fashioned cough-on-your-desk-buddy infection.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eResearchers are trying to suss out the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/17/health/coronavirus-herd-immunity.html?action=click\u0026amp;module=Top%20Stories\u0026amp;pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethreshold needed\u003c/a\u003e to stop COVID-19’s spread. Some peg it at 50% of a population or less.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAre we close? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCities with severe outbreaks this spring may have experienced enough community transmission to develop some form of herd immunity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNYC hasn’t seen a major uptick in infections this summer.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn some urban areas in India, where as many as 60% of residents contracted COVID, new cases have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2020-08-23/herd-immunity-in-india?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebegun to slow.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe city of Manaus experienced one of Brazil’s worst outbreaks, but hospitalizations and deaths have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/brazil-coronavirus-manaus-herd-immunity/2020/08/23/0eccda40-d80e-11ea-930e-d88518c57dcc_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efallen sharply\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since May. And Manaus never imposed strict lockdowns.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne country took a high-profile gamble on herd immunity. Sweden kept businesses open this spring, and a handful of health experts say the country has \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/sweden-has-developed-herd-immunity-after-refusing-to-lock-down-experts-claim-its-coronavirus-infection-rate-is-falling-2020-08-24?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeveloped\u003c/a\u003e resistance. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Many medical leaders are wary about declaring herd immunity. Subsequent outbreaks could still occur, and immunologists don’t know how long an immune response lasts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
